comments.message: Uses print() instead of Logger for consistency
comments.suggestion: Use Logger.log("Plugin '\(name)' modified outgoing message", level: .debug)

comments.message: Silently ignores plugin errors - could hide important issues
comments.suggestion: Use Logger.log("Plugin '\(name)' error processing incoming message: \(error)", level: .warning) and consider tracking error metrics

comments.message: Silently ignores plugin errors - could hide important issues
comments.suggestion: Use Logger.log("Plugin '\(name)' error processing outgoing message: \(error)", level: .warning) and consider tracking error metrics

suggestions: Replace all print() statements with Logger.log() for consistency
Add proper log levels (info, warning, error, debug)
Consider tracking plugin error metrics to monitor plugin health
Positive: Excellent use of actor for thread safety, good error handling with PluginError enum, clean protocol design with default implementations

review_summary.positive_notes: Excellent use of actor for thread safety, good error handling with PluginError enum, clean protocol design with default implementations. Using Logger instead of print() would improve consistency and provide better logging capabilities.
